questionList.qu: How many electrons does Carbon-14 have?
questionList.solution: Isotopes always have their number of protons and neutrons attached to the end. (14)

questionList.qu: How many electrons does Technetium-99 have?
questionList.solution: Isotopes always have their number of protons and neutrons attached to the end. (99)

questionList.qu: How many electrons does Boron-10 have?
questionList.solution: Isotopes always have their number of protons and neutrons attached to the end. (10)

questionList.qu: How many electrons does Oxygen-17 have?
questionList.solution: Isotopes always have their number of protons and neutrons attached to the end. (17)

questionList.qu: How many electrons does Chlorine-35 have?
questionList.solution: Isotopes always have their number of protons and neutrons attached to the end. (35)

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does Boron-10 have?
questionList.solution: To find the number of neutrons, subtract the number of protons (attached to the end of the name) from the mass number (10-5=5).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does Oxygen-17 have?
questionList.solution: To find the number of neutrons, subtract the number of protons (attached to the end of the name) from the mass number (17-8=9).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does Chlorine-35 have?
questionList.solution: To find the number of neutrons, subtract the number of protons (attached to the end of the name) from the mass number (35-17=18).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does Carbon-14 have?
questionList.solution: To find the number of neutrons, subtract the number of protons (attached to the end of the name) from the mass number (14-6=8).

questionList.qu: Using the periodic table, how many neutrons does Technetium-99 have?
questionList.solution: To find the number of neutrons, subtract the number of protons (attached to the end of the name) from the mass number (99-43=56).
